CARDINAL . Criminal proceedings concerning charges relating to offences committed in DATE

On DATE ORG charged the applicant with coercion , destruction of property , exposure to loss of health , assault and defamation . On DATE the charges against the applicant were supplemented by further ones . On the whole , he was charged with commission of CARDINAL offences . The Prosecutor ordered the applicant to undergo a psychiatric examination on an out - patient basis . As the psychiatrists found that it was impossible to give an objective assessment of the applicant ’s health on the basis of CARDINAL examination and as the applicant refused to comply with the order , on DATE the Prosecutor ordered that he should be placed in ORG psychiatric hospital for DATE observation . This decision was later quashed on the request of the hospital and the applicant ’s examination in ORG hospital was ordered . The applicant was invited to report to the hospital for examination , but he refused .

Apparently later the case was transferred to the office of ORG . On DATE the applicant was arrested on the order of ORG . On DATE the applicant was remanded in custody . He lodged an appeal against the detention order , however , and following a decision by ORG allowing his appeal , he was released on CARDINAL DATE .
On DATE ORG sent an indictment against the applicant to ORG .

On DATE ORG discontinued the proceedings against the applicant . The ORG found that the applicant had in his numerous letters proffered insults against various persons , including judges , prosecutors , agents of the ORG administration and psychiatrists involved in his psychiatric observations . However , the court observed that the applicant had been involved in many proceedings in which he had acquired a profound conviction that he had become a victim of an insidious and widespread conspiracy against him , and that , as a result , he developed a very strong negative emotional attitude towards the persons acting in their official capacity of ORG organs , bordering on psychosis . Thus , his actions could be regarded as being subjectively justified . On the objective side , the court analysed the applicant ’s conduct and considered that , despite its repetitive character and the violence of his verbal insults , it could not be considered as representing a serious danger , and in view thereof found that the applicant had no case to answer .
CARDINAL . Proceedings concerning the applicant ’s claim for compensation for wrongful detention from CARDINAL to DATE
On DATE the applicant lodged with ORG an action against ORG , claiming compensation for unjustified arrest on DATE and for detention on remand from DATE .
On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s claim , finding that the arrest had been justified . The applicant lodged an appeal .

On DATE ORG set aside the decision under appeal and awarded to the applicant compensation of CARDINAL PLZ ( old ) . The court found that the Prosecutor had informed the applicant , by a letter of DATE , that the date of his psychiatric examination had been fixed for DATE at TIME The Prosecutor had further warned the applicant that in case of his failure to comply with the summons , he would be taken to the hospital by the police . On DATE the Prosecutor ordered the police to arrest the applicant on DATE . The ORG considered that this order had in fact made it impossible for the applicant to comply with the summons to the hospital . The ORG further noted that , given that the criminal proceedings against the applicants had not been conducted diligently and that the applicant had been already questioned on several occasions by the Prosecutor , there was no indication that his arrest was , as argued by the Prosecutor in the order imposing detention on remand , necessary in order to secure the proper course of criminal proceedings . Moreover , there were no indications that the applicant ’s remaining at liberty would jeopardise the proper conduct of the proceedings in any manner . The court concluded that the applicant ’s detention was unjustified and in breach of the provisions concerning arrest and detention on remand .
Subsequently the Minister of ORG General lodged an extraordinary appeal against this judgment with ORG .

On DATE ORG allowed the Minister ’s extraordinary appeal , quashed the decision of DATE , considering that in the view of the applicant ’s repeated refusals to comply with the summonses to psychiatric examinations , his arrest and detention had been justified .
CARDINAL . Criminal proceedings concerning charges of uttering threats , instituted in DATE
On DATE ORG instituted criminal proceedings against the applicant on suspicion of having uttered threats . On DATE the applicant was charged with uttering threats .
On DATE ORG ordered that the applicant should be examined by CARDINAL psychiatrists and a psychologist so that his mental condition could be established .
By a letter of DATE ORG invited the applicant to report to ORG psychiatric hospital on DATE . On DATE the Prosecutor issued an order for the police to carry out the applicant ’s arrest on DATE .

On DATE at CARDINAL QUANTITY the applicant was arrested by the police . Later the police brought him to ORG hospital . He was discharged from the hospital at CARDINAL . TIME Apparently the applicant was later examined by a psychologist , who , in a report of CARDINAL DATE , concluded that he could be suffering from a situational paranoid syndrome .

On DATE ORG found the applicant guilty of uttering threats , considered that the applicant had at the critical time a diminished ability to understand the meaning of his acts , and sentenced him to a fine of CARDINAL PLZ ( new ) .
The applicant lodged an appeal . On DATE ORG imposed on him a fine of CARDINAL PLZ , considering that the appeal contained vulgar insults of the court .

On DATE ORG set the judgment under appeal aside and discontinued the criminal proceedings against the applicant . The court found that the findings of fact made by the lower court were well founded . The court went on to state that , taking into account the applicant ’s personal situation , the long - standing conflict between the applicant and the victims , the fact that the material events had occurred in broad daylight and in a public place so it had not been likely that the victims could have had a justified fear that he would realise his threats , the danger of the offence was minimal and the proceedings should be discontinued .
On an unspecified date the applicant lodged with the Suwałki Regional Court a civil action for compensation for his arrest on DATE .
On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s action .
The applicant lodged an appeal . He claimed in particular that he should be awarded compensation in a sum of CARDINAL PLZ .

On DATE ORG amended the decision under appeal in that it awarded to the applicant a compensation of CARDINAL PLZ . The court observed that on DATE the Prosecutor had ordered that a psychiatric opinion be obtained as to the applicant ’s mental health . In DATE the applicant had failed to comply with the summons for an out - patient examination . By a letter of DATE the Prosecutor invited the applicant to report to a hospital for an examination , and on DATE he ordered the police to proceed to the applicant ’s arrest in order to ensure that he be examined on DATE . The court considered that the ORG had thereby made it impossible for the applicant to comply with its own invitation to come to the examination of the applicant ’s own free will , which was clearly not in accordance with the purposes of arrest as set out by the applicable legal provisions . The court further observed that in the light of these provisions arrest had to be resorted to with prudence , as it was a coercive measure leading to a deprivation of liberty . In the present case , the applicant ’s arrest could have been lawfully ordered not earlier than on DATE , i. e , had it become already clear that the applicant had failed to report to the hospital as requested by the ORG ’s letter of CARDINAL DATE . The court referred to LAW ( b ) of the LAW and stated that in the light of the foregoing considerations , the applicant ’s arrest had been arbitrary and , consequently , it was not compatible with that provision of the LAW .
On thesatisfaction .
The applicant apparently lodged a cassation appeal against this judgment . On DATE the prosecutor likewise lodged such an appeal . The cassation proceedings are apparently pending .
